It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that thrives in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often革质 (leathery) and can vary in shape depending on the environment. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by water. This species is adapted to salt spray and wind, making it an important component of coastal vegetation.
